org.apache.juneau.transform

Class Transform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.transform.Transform
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeanTransform, PojoTransform, Transform.NULL

    public class Transform
extends Object
    Parent class for all bean and POJO transforms.
    Description

    Transforms are used to alter how POJOs are handled by bean contexts (and subsequently serializers and parsers). The are a very powerful feature of the Juneau framework that allows virtually any POJO to be serialized and parsed. For example, they can be used to...

    • Convert a non-serializable POJO into a serializable POJO during serialization (and optionally vis-versa during parsing).
    • Control various aspects of beans, such as what properties are visible, bean subclasses, etc...

    There are 2 subclasses of transforms:

    • PojoTransform - Non-bean transforms for converting POJOs into serializable equivalents.
    • BeanTransform - Bean transforms for configuring how beans are handled.

    Transforms are associated with bean contexts (and serializers/parsers) through the ContextFactory.addToProperty(String,Object) and CoreApi.addTransforms(Class[]) methods.

    Additional information
    See org.apache.juneau.transform for more information.
    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)
